channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live updates: Israel, Hezbollah trade heavy strikes; IDF sends more ground troops to Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Frances Vinall, Annabelle Timsit, Victoria Bisset, Mohamad El Chamaa, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Israel said it mobilized its first reserve division to operate in southwestern Lebanon. Hezbollah officials pledged to keep fighting.

item.title: Intrepid koala caught wandering train station, dangerously close to tracks
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Video showed the koala’s late night journey at Sydney’s Casula train station. Experts say deforestation and urbanization are driving the marsupials from their homes.

item.title: For a second day, Ukrainian hackers hit Russian institutions
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: Hackers attacked Russia’s digital state media hub and courts websites over two days, bringing both down.

item.title: Doctor admits wearing disguise to poison mom’s partner with fake covid shot
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: Thomas Kwan pleaded guilty to attempted murder at a court in England. He disguised himself as a nurse to inject his mom’s partner with a flesh-eating toxin.
